Docs.summary: Specifies how many times an instance of a template can be created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The TemplateInstance enumeration specifies values indicating the number of times an instance of a template can be created. The ttribute class uses values from the TemplateInstance enumeration. In particular, the ttribute.Single and ttribute.Multiple fields specify single and multiple instances of a template, respectively. A single instance of a template allows you to reference controls that are contained within the template.
Examples of controls that use the Single value in property metadata include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.CatalogZone> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.EditorZone> control, and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone.ZoneTemplate%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the TemplateInstance enumeration and the ttribute class. A custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView> control, named `MyLoginView`, overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.AnonymousTemplate%2A> property and uses the ttribute class to specify that only one instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.AnonymousTemplate%2A> property is created.

The following code example is an ASPX file that uses the `MyLoginView` control and demonstrates how to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control that is inside the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.LoginView.AnonymousTemplate%2A> property.
